alert.note: Alert for Tolland; Windham (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 16 at 10:33PM EDT until July 18 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...As of 1030 PM Sunday...The river level at the Willimantic River at Coventry is 7.91 ft, and river trend is slowly rising. Minor flood stage is 8.00 ft. At 8.00 ft, low lying flooding occurs along Flanders River Road and Thornbush Road in Mansfield and Coventry. Light to occasionally moderate rains are anticipated, and slow rises on the Willimantic River are likely through early overnight. The river is expected to recede early Monday morning with improving conditions. * WHERE...A portion of northern Connecticut, including the following counties, Tolland and Windham. * WHEN...Until 430 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Flanders River Rd and Thonbush Rd in Coventry and Mansfield experience low-lying flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1033 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mansfield, Willimantic, Coventry and Columbia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
